required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Exenatide Long-Acting Release on Glucose Control and Safety in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus(DURATION - 1)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open-Label, Multicenter, Comparator-Controlled Study to Examine the Effects of Exenatide Long-Acting Release on Glucose Control (HbA1c) and Safety in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Managed With Diet Modification and Exercise and/or Oral Antidiabetic Medications

brief_summary.textblock: A Randomized, Open-Label, Multicenter, Comparator-Controlled Study to Examine the Effects of Exenatide Long-Acting Release (LAR) on Glucose Control (HbA1c) and Safety in Subjects with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Managed with Diet Modification and Exercise and/or Oral Antidiabetic Medications.

detailed_description.textblock: This trial is designed to examine the effect of exenatide once weekly compared to exenatide twice daily on glucose control and safety in subjects for at least 30 weeks. The study is also designed to examine glucose control during the transition from exenatide twice daily for 30 weeks to exenatide once weekly. Long-term safety and efficacy will be monitored during the open-ended assessment periods. This study will be conducted in approximately 300 subjects with type 2 diabetes treated with diet modification and exercise alone or in combination with a stable regimen of metformin, SU, thiazolidinedione (TZD), a combination of metformin and SU, a combination of metformin and TZD, or a combination of SU and TZD.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Week 30
primary_outcome.description: Absolute change in HbA1c from Baseline (Day -3) to Week 30 [Week 30 - Baseline]

primary_outcome.measure: Sub-study Relative Bioavailability of Exenatide When Administered Using the Exenatide Once Weekly Dual Chambered Pen and the Exenatide Once Weekly Single Dose Tray (Single Dose Tray-11 Weekly Doses Switch to Dual Chamber Pen-11 Weekly Dose)
primary_outcome.description: Measure by Geometric mean ratio (GMR) of plasma exenatide average steady state concentration Css,avg at Visit 11-14 to Visit 24-27 with 90% confidence interval

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Week 364
secondary_outcome.description: Absolute change in HbA1c from Baseline (Day -3) to Week 364

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <7%
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects achieving HbA1c target value of <7% at Week 30.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <7%
secondary_outcome.description: Percentages of subjects achieving HbA1c target value of <7% at Week 364

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <=6.5%
secondary_outcome.description: Percentages of subjects achieving HbA1c target values of <=6.5% at Week 30.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <=6.5%
secondary_outcome.description: Percentages of subjects achieving HbA1c target values of <=6.5% at Week 364

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <=6.0%
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects achieving HbA1c target values of <=6.0% at Week 30.

secondary_outcome.measure: Exenatide LAR Steady State Concentration From Week 29 to Week 30
secondary_outcome.description: Steady-state plasma exenatide concentration over the dosing interval of Week 29 to Week 30 (0-168 hours) was evaluated. Geometric mean for the average steady-state concentration and its 10th and 90th percentiles were reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in 2 Hours (2h) Postprandial Glucose From Baseline to Week 14
secondary_outcome.description: Change in 2h Postprandial Glucose from baseline (Day -3) to Week 14

secondary_outcome.measure: Sub-study Safety and Tolerability of Exenatide When Administered Using the Once Weekly Single Dose Tray and the Once Weekly Dual (Single Dose Tray-11 Weekly Doses Switch to Dual Chamber Pen-11 Weekly Dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Measure by geometric mean ratio of the maximum steady state plasma exenatide concentration Css, max at Visit 11-14 to Visit 24-27 with 90% confidence interval and incidence of treatment-emergent injection site adverse events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Body Weight From Baseline to Week 30
secondary_outcome.description: Change in body weight from baseline (Day -3) to Week 30

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Body Weight From Baseline to Week 364
secondary_outcome.description: Change in body weight from baseline (Day -3) to Week 364

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting Plasma Glucose From Baseline to Week 30
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting plasma glucose from baseline (Day -3) to Week 30.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting Plasma Glucose From Baseline to Week 364
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting plasma glucose from baseline (Day -3) to Week 364.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Blood Pressure From Baseline to Week 30
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure and Sitting Systolic Blood Pressure from baseline to Week 30

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Blood Pressure From Baseline to Week 364
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure and Sitting Systolic Blood Pressure from baseline to Week 364

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Total Cholesterol From Baseline to Week 30
secondary_outcome.description: Change in total cholesterol from baseline (Day -3) to Week 30.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Total Cholesterol From Baseline to Week 364
secondary_outcome.description: Change in total cholesterol from baseline (Day -3) to Week 364.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in High-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C) From Baseline to Week 30
secondary_outcome.description: Change in high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) from baseline (Day -3) to Week 30.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in High-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C) From Baseline to Week 364
secondary_outcome.description: Change in high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) from baseline (Day -3) to Week 364.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Low-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C) From Baseline to Week 364
secondary_outcome.description: Change in low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) from baseline (Day -3) to Week 364.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio of Triglycerides at Week 30 to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio of triglycerides (measured in mg/dL) at Week 30 to baseline (Day -3). Log (Postbaseline Triglycerides) - log (Baseline Triglycerides); change from baseline to endpoint is presented as ratio of endpoint to baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio of Triglycerides at Week 364 to Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Ratio of triglycerides (measured in mg/dL) at Week 364 to baseline (Day -3). Log (Postbaseline Triglycerides) - log (Baseline Triglycerides); change from baseline to endpoint is presented as ratio of endpoint to baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment on Event Rate of Treatment-emergent Hypoglycemic Events With SU Use at Screening
secondary_outcome.description: The major hypoglycemia category included events that, in the judgment of the investigator or physician, resulted in loss of consciousness, seizure, coma, or other change in mental status consistent with neuroglycopenia, in which symptoms resolved after administration of intramuscular glucagon or intravenous glucose, required third-party assistance, and was accompanied by a blood glucose concentration of less than 54 mg/dL prior to treatment, whether or not symptoms of hypoglycemia were perceived by the subject. The minor hypoglycemia were accompanied by a blood glucose concentration of less than 54 mg/dL prior to treatment and not classified as major hypoglycemia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment on Event Rate of Treatment-emergent Hypoglycemic Events With Non-SU Use at Screening
secondary_outcome.description: The major hypoglycemia category included events that, in the judgment of the investigator or physician, resulted in loss of consciousness, seizure, coma, or other change in mental status consistent with neuroglycopenia, in which symptoms resolved after administration of intramuscular glucagon or intravenous glucose, required third-party assistance, and was accompanied by a blood glucose concentration of less than 54 mg/dL prior to treatment, whether or not symptoms of hypoglycemia were perceived by the subject. The minor hypoglycemia were accompanied by a blood glucose concentration of less than 54 mg/dL prior to treatment and not classified as major hypoglycemia.

arm_group.description: Subcutaneous injection (SC), once a week of long acting release (LAR) exenatide.

subcutaneous injection (SC), twice a day for the first 30 weeks, followed by exenatide LAR SC injection weekly for the remainder of the study. Sub-study: Exenatide 2 mg subcutaneous injection, Administered Using the Exenatide Once Weekly Single-Dose Tray , once a week for 11 visits, switch to Exenatide 2 mg subcutaneous injection, Administered Using the Dual chamber pen device. Exenatide 2mg SC injection administered using the Dual chamber pen device.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly -> Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily -> Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 26 weeks) followed by 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Week 30
outcome.description: Absolute change in HbA1c from Baseline (Day -3) to Week 30 [Week 30 - Baseline]
outcome.population: The ITT Population consisted of all randomized subjects who received at least one injection of study medication. Missing data up to Week 30 were imputed using the last observation carried forward (LOCF) approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 26 weeks) followed by 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

measure.title: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Week 30
measure.description: Absolute change in HbA1c from Baseline (Day -3) to Week 30 [Week 30 - Baseline]
measure.population: The ITT Population consisted of all randomized subjects who received at least one injection of study medication. Missing data up to Week 30 were imputed using the last observation carried forward (LOCF) approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

analysis.groups_desc: Superiority of exenatide long-acting release (LAR) once weekly to BYETTA if the upper limit of the 2-sided 95% confidence interval (CI) for treatment difference (LAR minus BYETTA) is less than 0; non-inferiority if this upper limit is less than 0.4%. Power:Assuming 20% dropout rate with 246 subjects will complete the study. This sample size would provide 90% power for non-inferiority test with assumption of greater reduction (0.1%) in LAR and a common standard deviation of 1.2%.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The choice of a 0.4% noninferiority margin was resulted from the considerations of expected clinical benefit of BYETTA in this study based on clinical data evaluating exenatide LAR and BYETTA, regulatory guidance, published literature, and statistical considerations.
analysis.method_desc: Analysis of variance (ANOVA) model includes treatment, baseline HbA1c stratum (<9% or >=9%), and concomitant SU use at screening as factors.

outcome.title: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Week 364
outcome.description: Absolute change in HbA1c from Baseline (Day -3) to Week 364
outcome.population: 7-Year Completer Population. Missing data up to Week 364 were imputed using the last observation carried forward (LOCF) approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly -> Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 26 weeks) followed by 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

outcome.title: Sub-study Relative Bioavailability of Exenatide When Administered Using the Exenatide Once Weekly Dual Chambered Pen and the Exenatide Once Weekly Single Dose Tray (Single Dose Tray-11 Weekly Doses Switch to Dual Chamber Pen-11 Weekly Dose)
outcome.description: Measure by Geometric mean ratio (GMR) of plasma exenatide average steady state concentration Css,avg at Visit 11-14 to Visit 24-27 with 90% confidence interval

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <7%
outcome.description: Percentage of subjects achieving HbA1c target value of <7% at Week 30.
outcome.population: ITT Population. Missing data up to Week 30 were imputed using LOCF for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement. Subjects without post-baseline measurement were categorized as not achieving goal.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 26 weeks).

measure.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <7%
measure.description: Percentage of subjects achieving HbA1c target value of <7% at Week 30.
measure.population: ITT Population. Missing data up to Week 30 were imputed using LOCF for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement. Subjects without post-baseline measurement were categorized as not achieving goal.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis: Percentages of subjects achieving HbA1c target value of <7% at Week 30 were compared between treatments using a Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel (CMH) test, in which baseline HbA1c stratum (<9% or >=9%) and concomitant SU use at screening served as the stratification factors. Null hypothesis: no difference between treatments in percentage of subjects achieving HbA1c target. Power: based on the primary measurement.

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <7%
outcome.description: Percentages of subjects achieving HbA1c target value of <7% at Week 364
outcome.population: 7-Year Completer Population. Missing data up to Week 364 were imputed using LOCF for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement. Subjects without post-baseline measurement were categorized as not achieving goal.

outcome.title: Exenatide LAR Steady State Concentration From Week 29 to Week 30
outcome.description: Steady-state plasma exenatide concentration over the dosing interval of Week 29 to Week 30 (0-168 hours) was evaluated. Geometric mean for the average steady-state concentration and its 10th and 90th percentiles were reported.
outcome.population: The Pharmacokinetics Population consisted of subjects who received exenatide LAR treatment, and had adequate plasma exenatide concentration-time data to allow for reliable evaluation of exenatide LAR pharmacokinetics.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

measure.title: Exenatide LAR Steady State Concentration From Week 29 to Week 30
measure.description: Steady-state plasma exenatide concentration over the dosing interval of Week 29 to Week 30 (0-168 hours) was evaluated. Geometric mean for the average steady-state concentration and its 10th and 90th percentiles were reported.
measure.population: The Pharmacokinetics Population consisted of subjects who received exenatide LAR treatment, and had adequate plasma exenatide concentration-time data to allow for reliable evaluation of exenatide LAR pharmacokinetics.

outcome.title: Change in 2 Hours (2h) Postprandial Glucose From Baseline to Week 14
outcome.description: Change in 2h Postprandial Glucose from baseline (Day -3) to Week 14
outcome.population: Evaluable Meal Tolerance Cohort consisted of ITT subjects who participated in the meal tolerance test and had adequate data to allow the reliable assessment of pharmacodynamics. Only subjects with non-missing baseline and Week 14 values were included in analysis.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 26 weeks).

measure.title: Change in 2 Hours (2h) Postprandial Glucose From Baseline to Week 14
measure.description: Change in 2h Postprandial Glucose from baseline (Day -3) to Week 14
measure.population: Evaluable Meal Tolerance Cohort consisted of ITT subjects who participated in the meal tolerance test and had adequate data to allow the reliable assessment of pharmacodynamics. Only subjects with non-missing baseline and Week 14 values were included in analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis: Change in 2h postprandial glucose from baseline (Day -3) to Week 14 was analyzed using an ANCOVA model including treatment, baseline HbA1c stratum (<9% or >=9%), and concomitant SU use at screening as factors, and baseline value of the 2h postprandial glucose as a covariate. Null hypothesis: no difference between treatments in change from baseline 2h postprandial glucose.

outcome.title: Sub-study Safety and Tolerability of Exenatide When Administered Using the Once Weekly Single Dose Tray and the Once Weekly Dual (Single Dose Tray-11 Weekly Doses Switch to Dual Chamber Pen-11 Weekly Dose)
outcome.description: Measure by geometric mean ratio of the maximum steady state plasma exenatide concentration Css, max at Visit 11-14 to Visit 24-27 with 90% confidence interval and incidence of treatment-emergent injection site adverse events.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis: Change in body weight from baseline (Day -3) to Week 30 was analyzed using an analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model including treatment, baseline HbA1c stratum (<9% or >=9%), and concomitant SU use at screening as factors, and baseline value of the body weight as a covariate. Null hypothesis: no difference between treatments in change from baseline body weight. Power: based on the primary measurement.

measure.title: Change in Blood Pressure From Baseline to Week 364
measure.description: Change in Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure and Sitting Systolic Blood Pressure from baseline to Week 364
measure.population: 7-Year Completer Population using observed data.

outcome.title: Change in Total Cholesterol From Baseline to Week 30
outcome.description: Change in total cholesterol from baseline (Day -3) to Week 30.
outcome.population: ITT Population. Missing data up to Week 30 were imputed using the LOCF approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 26 weeks).

measure.title: Change in Total Cholesterol From Baseline to Week 30
measure.description: Change in total cholesterol from baseline (Day -3) to Week 30.
measure.population: ITT Population. Missing data up to Week 30 were imputed using the LOCF approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis: Change in total cholesterol from baseline (Day -3) to Week 30 was analyzed using an ANCOVA model including treatment, baseline HbA1c stratum (<9% or >=9%), and concomitant SU use at screening as factors, and baseline value of the total cholesterol as a covariate. Null hypothesis: no difference between treatments in change from baseline total cholesterol. Power: based on the primary measurement.

outcome.title: Change in Total Cholesterol From Baseline to Week 364
outcome.description: Change in total cholesterol from baseline (Day -3) to Week 364.
outcome.population: 7-Year Completer Population. Missing data up to Week 364 were imputed using the LOCF approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly -> Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily -> Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 26 weeks) followed by 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

measure.title: Change in Total Cholesterol From Baseline to Week 364
measure.description: Change in total cholesterol from baseline (Day -3) to Week 364.
measure.population: 7-Year Completer Population. Missing data up to Week 364 were imputed using the LOCF approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

outcome.description: Change in high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) from baseline (Day -3) to Week 30.
outcome.population: ITT Population. Missing data up to Week 30 were imputed using the LOCF approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 26 weeks).

measure.title: Change in High-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C) From Baseline to Week 30
measure.description: Change in high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) from baseline (Day -3) to Week 30.
measure.population: ITT Population. Missing data up to Week 30 were imputed using the LOCF approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis: Change in HDL-C from baseline (Day -3) to Week 30 was analyzed using an ANCOVA model including treatment, baseline HbA1c stratum (<9% or >=9%), and concomitant SU use at screening as factors, and baseline value of the HDL as a covariate. Null hypothesis: no difference between treatments in change from baseline HDL. Power: based on the primary measurement.

outcome.title: Change in High-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C) From Baseline to Week 364
outcome.description: Change in high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) from baseline (Day -3) to Week 364.
outcome.population: 7-Year Completer Population. Missing data up to Week 364 were imputed using the LOCF approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily -> Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 26 weeks) followed by 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

measure.description: Change in high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) from baseline (Day -3) to Week 364.
measure.population: 7-Year Completer Population. Missing data up to Week 364 were imputed using the LOCF approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

outcome.description: Change in low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) from baseline (Day -3) to Week 364.
outcome.population: 7-Year Completer Population. Missing data up to Week 364 were imputed using the LOCF approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly -> Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily -> Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 26 weeks) followed by 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

measure.title: Change in Low-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C) From Baseline to Week 364
measure.description: Change in low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) from baseline (Day -3) to Week 364.
measure.population: 7-Year Completer Population. Missing data up to Week 364 were imputed using the LOCF approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

outcome.title: Ratio of Triglycerides at Week 30 to Baseline
outcome.description: Ratio of triglycerides (measured in mg/dL) at Week 30 to baseline (Day -3). Log (Postbaseline Triglycerides) - log (Baseline Triglycerides); change from baseline to endpoint is presented as ratio of endpoint to baseline.
outcome.population: ITT Population. Missing data up to Week 30 were imputed using the LOCF approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 26 weeks).

measure.title: Ratio of Triglycerides at Week 30 to Baseline
measure.description: Ratio of triglycerides (measured in mg/dL) at Week 30 to baseline (Day -3). Log (Postbaseline Triglycerides) - log (Baseline Triglycerides); change from baseline to endpoint is presented as ratio of endpoint to baseline.
measure.population: ITT Population. Missing data up to Week 30 were imputed using the LOCF approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis: Triglycerides data were logarithm-transformed and the change at Week 30 to baseline (Day -3), expressed as the ratio, was analyzed by an ANCOVA model including treatment, baseline HbA1c stratum (<9% or >=9%), and concomitant SU use at screening as factors, and baseline value of the triglycerides as a covariate. Null hypothesis: no difference between treatments in change from baseline triglycerides. Power: based on the primary measurement.

outcome.title: Ratio of Triglycerides at Week 364 to Baseline
outcome.description: Ratio of triglycerides (measured in mg/dL) at Week 364 to baseline (Day -3). Log (Postbaseline Triglycerides) - log (Baseline Triglycerides); change from baseline to endpoint is presented as ratio of endpoint to baseline.
outcome.population: 7-Year Completer Population. Missing data up to Week 364 were imputed using the LOCF approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly -> Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily -> Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 26 weeks) followed by 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

measure.title: Ratio of Triglycerides at Week 364 to Baseline
measure.description: Ratio of triglycerides (measured in mg/dL) at Week 364 to baseline (Day -3). Log (Postbaseline Triglycerides) - log (Baseline Triglycerides); change from baseline to endpoint is presented as ratio of endpoint to baseline.
measure.population: 7-Year Completer Population. Missing data up to Week 364 were imputed using the LOCF approach for subjects who had data for at least one scheduled visit (including Early Termination) subsequent to the baseline measurement.

outcome.title: Assessment on Event Rate of Treatment-emergent Hypoglycemic Events With SU Use at Screening
outcome.description: The major hypoglycemia category included events that, in the judgment of the investigator or physician, resulted in loss of consciousness, seizure, coma, or other change in mental status consistent with neuroglycopenia, in which symptoms resolved after administration of intramuscular glucagon or intravenous glucose, required third-party assistance, and was accompanied by a blood glucose concentration of less than 54 mg/dL prior to treatment, whether or not symptoms of hypoglycemia were perceived by the subject. The minor hypoglycemia were accompanied by a blood glucose concentration of less than 54 mg/dL prior to treatment and not classified as major hypoglycemia.
outcome.population: ITT Population who participated in the 30-week assessment period and using SU at screening.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly With SU
group.description: Subjects subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week using concomitant SU at screening. Week 0 to week 30.

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily With SU
group.description: Subjects with subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 26 weeks) using concomitant SU at screening. Week 0 to week 30.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly -> Exenatide Once Weekly With SU
group.description: Subjects subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week using concomitant SU at screening. Week 31 to week 364

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily -> Exenatide Once Weekly With SU
group.description: Subjects with subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 26 weeks) followed by 2 mg exenatide, once a week using concomitant SU at screening. Week 31 to week 364.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly With SU
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week using concomitant SU at screening. Pooling unique subjects from exenatide once weekly (WK 0-30), exenatide once weekly -> exenatide once weekly (WK 31-364), and exenatide twice daily -> exenatide once weekly (WK 31-364).

measure.title: Assessment on Event Rate of Treatment-emergent Hypoglycemic Events With SU Use at Screening
measure.description: The major hypoglycemia category included events that, in the judgment of the investigator or physician, resulted in loss of consciousness, seizure, coma, or other change in mental status consistent with neuroglycopenia, in which symptoms resolved after administration of intramuscular glucagon or intravenous glucose, required third-party assistance, and was accompanied by a blood glucose concentration of less than 54 mg/dL prior to treatment, whether or not symptoms of hypoglycemia were perceived by the subject. The minor hypoglycemia were accompanied by a blood glucose concentration of less than 54 mg/dL prior to treatment and not classified as major hypoglycemia.
measure.population: ITT Population who participated in the 30-week assessment period and using SU at screening.

outcome.title: Assessment on Event Rate of Treatment-emergent Hypoglycemic Events With Non-SU Use at Screening
outcome.description: The major hypoglycemia category included events that, in the judgment of the investigator or physician, resulted in loss of consciousness, seizure, coma, or other change in mental status consistent with neuroglycopenia, in which symptoms resolved after administration of intramuscular glucagon or intravenous glucose, required third-party assistance, and was accompanied by a blood glucose concentration of less than 54 mg/dL prior to treatment, whether or not symptoms of hypoglycemia were perceived by the subject. The minor hypoglycemia were accompanied by a blood glucose concentration of less than 54 mg/dL prior to treatment and not classified as major hypoglycemia.
outcome.population: ITT Population who participated in the 30-week assessment period and not using SU at screening.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly With Non-SU
group.description: Subjects subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week not using concomitant SU at screening. Week 0 to week 30.

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily With Non-SU
group.description: Subjects with subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 26 weeks) not using concomitant SU at screening. Week 0 to week 30.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly -> Exenatide Once Weekly With Non-SU
group.description: Subjects subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week not using concomitant SU at screening. Week 31 to week 364

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily -> Exenatide Once Weekly With Non-SU
group.description: Subjects with subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 26 weeks) followed by 2 mg exenatide, once a week not using concomitant SU at screening. Week 31 to week 364.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly With Non-SU
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week not using concomitant SU at screening. Pooling unique subjects from exenatide once weekly (WK 0-30), exenatide once weekly -> exenatide once weekly (WK 31-364), and exenatide twice daily -> exenatide once weekly (WK 31-364).

measure.title: Assessment on Event Rate of Treatment-emergent Hypoglycemic Events With Non-SU Use at Screening
measure.description: The major hypoglycemia category included events that, in the judgment of the investigator or physician, resulted in loss of consciousness, seizure, coma, or other change in mental status consistent with neuroglycopenia, in which symptoms resolved after administration of intramuscular glucagon or intravenous glucose, required third-party assistance, and was accompanied by a blood glucose concentration of less than 54 mg/dL prior to treatment, whether or not symptoms of hypoglycemia were perceived by the subject. The minor hypoglycemia were accompanied by a blood glucose concentration of less than 54 mg/dL prior to treatment and not classified as major hypoglycemia.
measure.population: ITT Population who participated in the 30-week assessment period and not using SU at screening.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly (WK 0-30)
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily (WK 0-30)
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 26 weeks).

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly -> Exenatide Once Weekly (WK 31-364)
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

group.title: Exenatide Twice Daily -> Exenatide Once Weekly (WK 31-364)
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of exenatide, twice a day (5 mcg exenatide per dose for first 4 weeks, then 10 mcg exenatide per dose for 26 weeks) followed by 2 mg exenatide, once a week.

group.title: Exenatide Once Weekly
group.description: Subcutaneous injection of 2 mg exenatide, once a week. Pooling unique subjects from exenatide once weekly (WK 0-30), exenatide once weekly -> exenatide once weekly (WK 31-364), and exenatide twice daily -> exenatide once weekly (WK 31-364).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
